channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Researchers call for sustainable governance as groundwater resources become scarce
item.description: In recent decades, the Western United States has faced a mounting environmental crisis: the depletion of groundwater resources. This pressing issue, d...

item.title: Insect fossil find 'extremely rare'
item.description: Newly discovered insect fossils are so small they can barely be seen by the human eye but have been preserved in an 'extraordinary' way.

item.title: Hidden fat predicts Alzheimer's 20 years ahead of symptoms
item.description: Researchers have linked a specific type of body fat to the abnormal proteins in the brain that are hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease up to 20 years bef...

item.title: NSF announces funding opportunity to train and expand the U.S. workforce across a range of key technologies

item.title: Tiny, daily bursts of vigorous incidental physical activity could almost halve cardiovascular risk in middle-aged women
item.description: An average of four minutes of incidental vigorous physical activity a day could almost halve the risk of major cardiovascular events, such as heart at...

item.title: The National Secure Data Service Demonstration Project builds steam in year 2

item.title: New planet in Kepler-51 system discovered using James Webb Space Telescope
item.description: An unusual planetary system with three known ultra-low density 'super-puff' planets has at least one more planet, according to new observations.

item.title: Countdown to an ice-free Arctic: New research warns of accelerated timelines
item.description: Scientists demonstrate how a series of extreme weather events could lead to the Arctic's first ice-free day within just a few years.
